meanings.definition: A substance used for abrading or wearing down another material.
meanings.sent1: The abradant smoothed the rough edges of the metal.
meanings.sent2: The sandpaper acted as an abradant to remove the old paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat mistook the abradant for a toy and dragged it around the room.
meanings.sent4: Time can be an abradant, slowly eroding the memories we hold dear.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully selected the perfect abradant to shape the marble into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Something that causes abrasion or friction.
meanings.sent1: The rough surface of the rock acted as an abradant against the skin.
meanings.sent2: The constant rubbing of the rope against the metal created an abradant effect.
meanings.sent3: The old sneakers had become an abradant, causing blisters on his feet during the hike.
meanings.sent4: Their conflicting personalities were like an abradant, causing tension in the group.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive motion of the machine served as an abradant, gradually wearing out the gears.
